revised_title: Selective Absorption Spectra of Cobalt Chloride, Cobalt Bromide, and Cobalt Iodide in Concentrated Hydrochloric, Hydrobromic, and Hydriodic Acids
tldr: The authors conducted a study on the absorption spectra of solutions of cobalt chloride, cobalt bromide, and cobalt iodide in concentrated hydrochloric, hydrobromic, and hydriodic acids. They found that the absorption bands of these compounds are composed of superimposed bands with frequencies of maximal absorption at integral multiples of a common or fundamental frequency. The study provides insights into the selective absorption and chemical analysis of these cobalt compounds.
